Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 had an inappropriate relationship with Youth A while she
worked at the facility.
Investigation Interviews:
On 5/15/25 Complainant was interviewed. Complainant did not
provide any new details.
On 6/2/25 Youth A was interviewed at the CAC center in
Saginaw. Youth A reported he had a relationship with Staff 1.
Youth A reported Staff 1 was his girlfriend. Youth A reported Staff
1 would sit close to him when they played cards. Youth A reported
they also write letters to one another. Youth A described one of
those letters as an apology letter he wrote to Staff 1 after he yelled
at her. Youth A reported Staff 1 gave him her phone number, but
he couldn’t remember it, nor did he have it somewhere to show
us. Youth A reported Staff 1 touched his penis, by “grabbing his
shit for a couple seconds.” Youth A reported this happened during
a power outage at the facility. Youth A reported Staff 1 followed
him into the bathroom that night and touched him there. Youth A
reported he hit her butt once and she turned around and smiled.
Youth A reported he also touched her breasts over her clothes
2

and one time under her clothes. Youth A reported he does not
have any of the letters they sent each other because he destroyed
them. Youth A reported he wrote her a valentine’s card, and she
wrote one back, but he ripped it and flushed it down the toilet.
Youth A reported Staff 1 was moved from the unit after
Administrator 1 knew about one of the letters they wrote. Youth A
reported in his interview that Staff 1 gave him over 20 breezes.
Youth A also reported that Youth E had a relationship with an
unknown staff as well.
Administrator 1 was interviewed on 6/2/25 at the facility with
DHHS Worker. Administrator reported about two months ago
Youth A wrote Staff 1 a letter. In the letter it stated, Youth A was
sorry about yelling at her and asked her to forgive him. It also
called Staff 1 “lil mama” in the letter. Administrator 1 reported she
gave Staff 1 discipline for the letter for inappropriate
communication with a youth.
On 6/25/25 the following interviews occurred at the facility
with DHHS Worker and Vassar Police:
Youth B reported he knew about Youth A and Staff 1’s
relationship. He heard they hugged and touched each other.
Youth B reported he did not see this. Youth B reported he has
seen Youth A and Staff 1 play the card game “spades” with each
other. Youth B reported Youth A told him Staff 1 and Youth A had
a relationship but never saw them touching and Youth A never
stated they touched. Youth B reported Youth A wrote Staff 1 a
valentine’s card, but Supervisor 1 took it and threw it away. Youth
B denied Staff 1 provided breezes for the youth.
Youth C reported Staff 1 was strict. Youth C reported he never
saw Staff 1 close to any of the youth and she didn’t show favor to
anyone. Youth C reported he never saw her bring gifts to anyone.
Youth C reported he never heard Staff 1 have inappropriate
conversations with any youth nor touch any youth. Youth C
reported she is “not like that.” Youth C denied Staff 1 provided
breezes for the youth.
Youth D was interviewed on 10/2/25 face to face at the facility.
Youth D reported Youth A had a relationship with Staff 1. Youth D
reported they would play cards together and go in the back room.
Youth D reported he went to the back room once and she was
talking to him about her sexual relationships. Youth D reported he
never saw them touching or kissing. Youth D reported Staff 1 was
an “argumentative” staff when she worked. Youth D reported Staff
3

1 never said anything to him about her relationship with Youth A.
Youth D denied Staff 1 provided breezes for the youth.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 via telephone on 10/2/25. Supervisor 1
reported he never saw Staff 1 interact with any of the youth
inappropriately. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 always treated all
the youth the same. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 turned in a
letter to him that Youth A wrote her. The letter apologized for his
behavior and said “beau” at the end of the letter. Supervisor 1
reported Staff 1 gave it to him and stated she didn’t want to be
involved in any “mess.” Supervisor 1 reported that there were
some male youth in the program that would “claim” female staff.
They would call dibs on the female staff as if the female staff
would be their girlfriends. Supervisor 1 reported this was not true
and there were no relationships between any of the male youth
and the female staff. Supervisor 1 denied Staff 1 provided breezes
for the youth.
I left a voicemail for Staff 1, Supervisor 2, and Staff 2 on 10/2/25,
10/13/25, and 10/20/25. It is to be noted that all three of those
staff no longer work at the facility. I have not received a return call.
I attempted phone contacts with Youth E on 10/21/25 and
10/23/25. I have not received a return call.
Documentation:
• Vassar Police Department Case Report #250001202.
Additional details from Officer’s interview with Staff 1:
o Staff 1 received a Valentine’s card from Youth A and
gave this to Supervisor 1.
o Staff 1 gave an apology letter to Administrator 1 and
a PREA investigation was initiated.
o Email from DHHS Worker on 9/8/25. DHHS Worker
completed an unannounced visit to Staff 1’s home
on 9/8/25. Staff 1 reported she played cards with the
youth at the facility. Staff 1 reported Youth A would
flirt with her, and she would “shut this down” and
denied ever flirting back. Staff 1 reported she knew
he was flirting with her because he would call her
“mama.” Staff 1 denied ever touching Youth A. She
said he called her "lil mama" in the note but denied
she ever saw this or it was given to her. She said
Administrator called her into her office and "berated"
her for the letter saying it wasn't appropriate. Staff 1
felt like this was inappropriate because she knew
nothing about the letter or what it said. Staff 1
4

thought her supervisor at that time was Supervisor 2
but was unsure. Staff 1 was adamant Youth A never
touched her anywhere on her body. She also
denied touching him, stating she never touched his
penis. Staff 1 reported she remembers the power
outage and she did not go into the restroom with
him. Staff 1 denied having any contact with Youth A
outside of employment and denied giving Youth A
her social media or phone number.
• Email from MDHHS Worker on 9/29/25:
Youth E reported he was never involved with any female
staff at the facility. Youth E reported Staff 1 never gave the
youth vapes. Youth E reported he never saw an
inappropriate relationship between Youth A and Staff 1.
• Staff 1 personnel file. Criminal clearances and central
registry were up to date. Staff 1 had disciplinary action in
her file but none that pertained to the current allegations. It
is to be noted there was not a discipline action completed
as Administrator reported concerning “communication” due
to the letter received from Youth A. Staff 1 was terminated
on 5/6/25 for “antagonistic and combative behavior with a
client.”
• There were no letters to review.
• There were no incident reports to review.
*There were no videos to observe the incident in question.
Analysis The agency is compliant with the above rule. There is not enough
evidence to validate the allegations.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
